etymologies: named after Graman Quassi, an 18th-century Surinamese slave who discovered its medicinal properties in 1730

definitions: a South American shrub or small tree related to ailanthus.

notes.text: Genera Quassia and Picrasma, family Simaroubaceae: several species, in particular Q. amara

shortDefinitions: South American shrub or small tree related to ailanthus

definitions: the wood, bark, or root of the quassia, yielding a bitter medicinal tonic, insecticide, and vermifuge.
shortDefinitions: wood, bark, or root of quassia, yielding bitter medicinal tonic and vermifuge
